intro: Laphamia bisetosa, commonly known as the two-flowered laphamia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-flowered inflorescences. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are typically pink to purple, with two distinct lobes, and are arranged in pairs along the stem. Laphamia bisetosa thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
